Compulsory education is a contradiction - people cannot be forced to learn. Learning is the process by which an individual has questions and finds the answer to them. Therefore, if there is no question being asked, no learning can occur. People cannot be compelled to genuinely ask questions, to seek knowledge. They can be compelled to listen to someone yak for seven hours a day, but if there are no questions being asked, no learning is done.
 
 Therefore, the only genuine "education" is one that is sought voluntarily. Only when a question is asked can any learning occur, and questions must arise from genuine curiosity rather than threats from people with bludgeons. To compel a student to listen to a teacher drone on about something that does not interest him constitutes a compulsory waste of his time, which he could otherwise use seeking answers to his own questions, i.e. learning. Compulsory education hampers the process of learning.
